title: IMFs - Br2 is a liquid and Cl2 is a gas at 298K

content.prompt: At 298 K and 1 atm, bromine is a liquid with a high vapor pressure, whereas chlorine is a gas. This provides evidence that, under these conditions, the

choices.label: forces among Br2 molecules are greater than those among Cl2 molecules
forces among Br2 molecules are weaker than the Br—Br bond
Br—­Br bond is stronger than the Cl—Cl bond
Br—­Br bond is weaker than the Cl—Cl bond

skill.text: 6.C: Support a claim with evidence from representations or models at the particulate level, such as the structure of atoms and/or molecules.
